conclusion: Solve problem step-by-step to find electric force on ball S₁ at point M
Points A, B, M, N are at distance √2L from O; A and B on horizontal line with O as midpoint; M and N on perpendicular bisector of AB; x-axis points vertically downward with O as origin
Points form a circle with radius √2L centered at O
Distance from M to A and B is L√3
Electric field at M due to charge at A: kQ/r_{MA}^2; Electric field at M due to charge at B: kQ/r_{MB}^2
Horizontal components of fields cancel out; vertical components add up; total vertical electric field at M is 2√6kQ/9L^2
Electric force on S₁ at M is 2√6kQ^2/9L^2
Figure (c) shows acceleration at point M is 2g
Acceleration at M is due to gravity and electric force; F_E/m = g
Figure (b) shows electric potential varies with position x; at x=0, potential is √2kQ/L
Electric force at M is mg
Magnitude of electric force on ball S₁ at M is mg
